en: In my distress I cried unto Jehovah, And he answered me.
hmr: Ka lunginzîng ni chun LALPA chu ka ko a, Chuongchun, ama chun a mi hung dawn a.

en: Deliver my soul, O Jehovah, from lying lips, And from a deceitful tongue.
hmr: Aw LALPA, hmûr khêlhliphai le, lei mi hlêm hmanghaia inthawk chun, Ka hringna hi sanhim rawh.

en: What shall be given unto thee, and what shall be done more unto thee, Thou deceitful tongue?
hmr: Nang lei mi hlêm hmang, I kuomah ieng am pêng an ti cheh a, ieng am belsâng an ti cheh a?

en: Sharp arrows of the mighty, With coals of juniper.
hmr: Mi hrât thal inzumtakhai, Juniper thing inlinghai leh,

en: Woe is me, that I sojourn in Meshech, That I dwell among the tents of Kedar!
hmr: Meshekhai rama ka châm le, Kedarhai puon ina ka um hi, ka chung a va rik de!

en: My soul hath long had her dwelling With him that hateth peace.
hmr: Ka hringna hin inremna theidatu kuomah, Sâwttak umna a nei tah a.

en: I am for peace: But when I speak, they are for war.
hmr: Kei chu inrem ka nuom a, Nisienlakhawm, thu ka hril phingleh indo an nuom hlak.
